hints.content:
First, we need to find $21$ cm on the number line.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fcda49abddef1820331b3d42bb23a64f3c31d637)

Each dot represents one cereal box. 

So, we need to count all of the dots on the line plot that represent lengths shorter than $21$ cm.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ca766a3e0777f4e48a0f0eb1b74cf360c5edd282)

There are $\blueE3$ dots that represent lengths shorter than $21$ cm.   

$\blueE3$ cereal boxes are shorter than $21$ cm.

question.content:
The lengths of cereal boxes are shown below.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/31b481b50b36977a78731652ab427465a0fc317c)


**How many cereal boxes are shorter than $21$ centimeters?**  

[[â˜ƒ input-number 1]] cereal boxes
